    static void
    main(String[] args)
    Main method to run the actual code: (1) partition all valid movie records into new genre-based1 text files, (2) load an array of movie records from each of the partitioned text file, serializing the resulting movie array to a binary file, and (3) deserialize (reconstruct) the serialized arrays from the binary files into a 2D array of movie record objects, and finally provide an interactive program that allows the user to navigate a movie array, displaying user-specified number of movie-records.
    static int
    navigateGenre(Movie[] movies, int currentGenreIndex, int currentMovieIndex, Scanner keyin)
    Navigate movies in the current genre
    static void
    navigateMovies(Movie[][] all_movies)
    The method will provide a vertical view of the objects within a movie array, allowing the user to display a range of records above or below the current movie record at its current position, which is initially set to the index of the first record in the array.

  • Constructor Details

    • Driver

      public Driver()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method to run the actual code: (1) partition all valid movie records into new genre-based1 text files, (2) load an array of movie records from each of the partitioned text file, serializing the resulting movie array to a binary file, and (3) deserialize (reconstruct) the serialized arrays from the binary files into a 2D array of movie record objects, and finally provide an interactive program that allows the user to navigate a movie array, displaying user-specified number of movie-records.
      Parameters:
      args - String[]

    • do_part1

      public static String do_part1(String part1_manifest)
      Part1: Validating the inputStream and partition movies based on genre Input: 10 movies CSV files. Read and write the name of movies file names into "part1_manifest.txt"; Use the names in the "part1_manifest.txt" then read the file and check each movie record Output: 19 files (1: "bad_movie_records.txt"; 17 : CSV files; 1 : part2_manifest.txt record genre CSV file names)
      Parameters:
      part1_manifest - String directory name
      Returns:
      String

    • writeFileNames

      public static String[] writeFileNames(String inputPath, String outputPath)
      This method will read the files and then sort and write the name into output txt file and finally return the String array of file names
      Parameters:
      inputPath - String
      outputPath - String
      Returns:
      String[] file names

    • sortName

      public static void sortName(String[] fileNames, int count)
      Sort the movie file names in order to better display output
      Parameters:
      fileNames - String[] array of sorted file names
      count - array element count

    • checkSyntaxError

      public static void checkSyntaxError(String line) throws MissingQuotesException, ExcessFieldsException, MissingFieldsException
      Check for Syntax Error : A CSV record is valid if it has exactly 10 data fields;
      Parameters:
      line - The input line from csv file
      Throws:
      MissingQuotesException - When title has quotes, at least one of \" is missing
      ExcessFieldsException - Too many fields
      MissingFieldsException - Fields less than 10

    • splitLineIntoFields

      public static String[] splitLineIntoFields(String line)
      Split the line into fields of movie Precondition : The line doesn't have Syntax Error
      Parameters:
      line - String
      Returns:
      String[] fields

    • checkSemanticError

      public static void checkSemanticError(String[] fields) throws BadYearException, BadDurationException, BadGenreException, BadRatingException, BadTitleException, BadNameException, BadScoreException
      Checking for Semantic Error
      Parameters:
      fields - String[]
      Throws:
      BadYearException - year less than 1990 or greater than 1999 | unconvertible String | Missing
      BadDurationException - Not an integer from 30 through 300 minutes | Missing
      BadGenreException - Not a valid genre listed in the instruction | Missing
      BadRatingException - Not a valid rating listed in the instruction | Missing
      BadTitleException - A quoted title may not contain double quotes within its text | Missing
      BadNameException - Missing
      BadScoreException - Not a positive double value less than or equal 10 | Missing

    • do_part2

      public static String do_part2(String part2_manifest)
      Part2: Create and Serialize Arrays of Movie Records For each csv file named in part2_manifest.txt, say abc.csv, load the records from the file into an array of Movie objects and then serialize the array into a binary file named abc.ser. Output: 1 file called "part3_manifest.txt" recording the SER file names, and 17 binary SER files.
      Parameters:
      part2_manifest - String
      Returns:
      String

      Determine the number of movies in the csv file in order to allocate the array length
      Parameters:
      csvFileName - File
      Returns:
      int (the number of movies)
      Throws:
      IOException - error when opening the file

    • navigateMovies

      public static void navigateMovies(Movie[][] all_movies)
      The method will provide a vertical view of the objects within a movie array, allowing the user to display a range of records above or below the current movie record at its current position, which is initially set to the index of the first record in the array.
      Parameters:
      all_movies - Movie[][]
